SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Sort Results on the Bot-Enabled and Standard Product List Page by the Same Criteria

Reduce the potential for content cloaking, which can affect your storefront's search ranking. The bot-enabled Product List page now sorts products by the same default criteria that you specify for sorting results on the standard Product List page. With this change, human users and search engine bots experience the same content, which better aligns with search engine guidelines.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, products on the bot-enabled Product List page sorted only by Sequence, regardless of the standard page's default sort option. If you specified any default sort option other than Sequence, human users and search engine bots experienced different content on the Product List page.

How: When you upgrade the managed package and enable bot detection, this change is available automatically on the bot-enabled Product List page.

NOTE Only version 2.0 of the Product List page supports the bot-enabled page.
